page.title: 19BRANDON LANE GOLF COURSE
page.content: The course belongs to{Coventry Council {Leisure Services Dept.}and is situated along the west bank of the river{Avon about 10Kms from the city centre. The course covers{213 acres,}but only {135 acres}are played on:The remainder is scrub and wetland at present. There are{18 holes, Par 72.}About {42000 rounds}are played a year. There is also a Driving Range, a Putting Green and a Clubhouse. The major problem is the frequency of {flooding}which puts many holes out of use. There are several reserve holes for just such a situation but more are needed. Hence there are{plans}to turn the wetlands into standby holes. This is, however, being strongly fought by local{conservationists.}The Groundsman {Mr.T. Curtis}feels that the course does{help wildlife}already and it also {helps people}to relax.
